alert.note: Alert for East Polk; McMinn; Northwest Monroe; Southeast Monroe; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 11:16PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN CHEROKEE...NORTHEASTERN POLK...EAST CENTRAL MCMINN AND SOUTHERN MONROE COUNTIES THROUGH 1245 AM EDT... At 1215 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 13 miles southeast of Madisonville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Andrews, Englewood, Tellico Plains, Coker Creek, Violet, Tariffville, Bullet Creek, Hiawasse Dam, Marble, and Mount Vernon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for southwestern North Carolina...and east Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: East Polk; McMinn; Northwest Monroe; Southeast Monroe; West Polk
